name: Daniel Rey Cimafranca
text: First make it work (ship), only then can you make it better (tune/clean).  Better if there's a way to automate testing so a midlevel developer can just comment out chunks and see if an error is thrown.  Otherwise you will need experienced developers to do the cleanup, which leaves less experienced developers writing new code.  It will end up as an endless cycle of novices making a mess and experts cleaning up after them rather than having a quality at source/start development culture because the tools to do so are available (not relying solely on experience).
